summaryText: What an incredible message from Pastor Travis Hearn about making room for Jesus and using our influence for God's Kingdom! In this powerful sermon from Mark chapter 2, PT walks us through the incredible story of four friends who were so committed to bringing their paralyzed friend to Jesus that they literally dug through a roof. Can you imagine that level of determination? The sermon challenges us to ask: Are we making room for Jesus in every area of our lives? Pastor Travis breaks down three key lessons from these men: compassion, commitment, and courage. He reminds us that we ALL have influence - whether we realize it or not. Just like salt seasons food and light illuminates darkness, we are called to season and shine in our world. The most powerful moment? When he shared how one social media post by a Phoenix Suns player led to multiple people giving their lives to Christ - including the Diamondbacks mascot! Pastor Travis's message is clear: Your influence matters, and God wants to use YOU to impact others for His Kingdom.
mainPoints: We can show compassion by seeing others' perspectives
Commitment means pushing through obstacles to reach Jesus
Courage involves taking radical steps to bring others to Christ

versesMentioned.text: A few days later, when Jesus again entered Capernaum, the people heard that he had come home. They gathered in such large numbers that there was no room left, even outside the door, and he preached the word to them. Some men came, bringing to him a paralyzed man, carried by four of them. Since they could not get him to Jesus because of the crowd, they made an opening in the roof above Jesus by digging through it and then lowered the mat the man was lying on. When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralyzed man, 'Son, your sins are forgiven.'

You are the salt of the earth. But if the salt loses its saltiness, how can it be made salty again? It is no longer good for anything, except to be thrown out and trampled underfoot. You are the light of the world. A town built on a hill cannot be hidden. Neither do people light a lamp and put it under a bowl. Instead they put it on its stand, and it gives light to everyone in the house. In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.

Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age.
But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes on you; and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.

Monday.scripture: Matthew 5:16: 'In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.'
Monday.action: Identify three people in your life who might need encouragement or an invitation to church. Write their names down and pray specifically for them.
Monday.prayer: Lord, show me the people in my sphere of influence who need Your love. Give me courage and wisdom to shine Your light today. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Colossians 4:5-6: 'Be wise in the way you act toward outsiders; make the most of every opportunity. Let your conversation be always full of grace, seasoned with salt.'
Tuesday.action: Practice being intentionally kind and gracious in at least one conversation today. Look for an opportunity to genuinely encourage someone.
Tuesday.prayer: God, help me be a vessel of Your love and grace. Give me opportunities to share Your hope with others today. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: 1 Peter 3:15: 'But in your hearts revere Christ as Lord. Always be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have. But do this with gentleness and respect.'
Wednesday.focus: Being prepared to share your faith
Wednesday.action: Write down your personal testimony - how Jesus has changed your life. Practice sharing it concisely and naturally.
Wednesday.prayer: Lord, help me be bold yet gentle in sharing my faith. Give me confidence in Your transformative power. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Proverbs 11:25: 'A generous person will prosper; whoever refreshes others will be refreshed.'
Thursday.action: Do something unexpectedly kind for someone - a coworker, family member, or stranger. Look for ways to demonstrate God's love practically.
Thursday.prayer: Father, make me an instrument of Your compassion. Help me see others the way You see them. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Romans 10:14: 'How, then, can they call on the one they have not believed in? And how can they believe in the one of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them?'
Friday.action: Invite someone to church this weekend. If that feels too intimidating, share a positive social media post about your faith journey.
Friday.prayer: God, give me boldness and love. Help me be a bridge that connects people to Your hope. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Matthew 9:37-38: 'The harvest is plentiful but the workers are few. Ask the Lord of the harvest, therefore, to send out workers into his harvest field.'
Saturday.action: Spend time in prayer for your community, church, and the people you know who don't know Christ. Ask God to use you in His mission.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, break my heart for what breaks Yours. Use me as Your instrument to bring hope and healing to others. Amen.
